content.question: This question is a short free-response question. Show your work for each part of the question. One end of a string is secured to the ceiling of a classroom, and the other end of the string is attached to a sphere of mass <math alttext="0.2 kilogram"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> so that a pendulum is established. The sphere is raised at an angle of <math alttext="15 degrees"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> above the sphere’s equilibrium position and then released from rest so that the pendulum oscillates, as shown in the figure. Location 1 is shown in the figure. A graph of the pendulum’s horizontal position as a function of time is shown in the graph. (a) The dot below represents the sphere at location 2. Draw a free-body diagram that shows and labels the forces (not components) exerted on the sphere at the location. Draw the relative lengths of all vectors to reflect the relative magnitudes of all forces.
